intro: Sida ectogama, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its small, pale yellow flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Sida ectogama is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields, where it thrives in full sun.
